All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, CooMatrixMixin<CooFieldMatrix<T>,FieldMatrix<T>,CooFieldVector<T>,FieldVector<T>,Field<T>[],T>, MatrixMixinOld<CooFieldMatrix<T>,FieldMatrix<T>,CooFieldVector<T>,FieldVector<T>,Field<T>[],T>, MatrixVectorOpsMixin<CooFieldMatrix<T>,CooFieldVector<T>,FieldVector<T>>, SparseTensorMixin<FieldMatrix<T>,CooFieldMatrix<T>>, TensorBinaryOpsMixin<CooFieldMatrix<T>,CooFieldMatrix<T>>, TensorMixin<CooFieldMatrix<T>,Field<T>[],T>
public class CooFieldMatrix<T extends Field<T>> extends CooFieldMatrixBase<CooFieldMatrix<T>,FieldMatrix<T>,CooFieldVector<T>,FieldVector<T>,T>

A sparse matrix stored in coordinate list (COO) format. The AbstractTensor.entries of this COO tensor are elements of a Field.

The non-zero entries and non-zero indices of a COO matrix are mutable but the AbstractTensor.shape and total number of non-zero entries is fixed.

Sparse matrices allow for the efficient storage of and operations on matrices that contain many zero values.

COO matrices are optimized for hyper-sparse matrices (i.e. matrices which contain almost all zeros relative to the size of the matrix).

A sparse COO matrix is stored as:

  • The full shape of the matrix.
  • The non-zero AbstractTensor.entries of the matrix. All other entries in the matrix are assumed to be zero. Zero values can also explicitly be stored in AbstractTensor.entries.
  • The row indices of the non-zero values in the sparse matrix.
  • The column indices of the non-zero values in the sparse matrix.

Note: many operations assume that the entries of the COO matrix are sorted lexicographically by the row and column indices. (i.e.) by row indices first then column indices. However, this is not explicitly verified but any operations implemented in this class will preserve the lexicographical sorting.

If indices need to be sorted, call CooFieldMatrixBase.sortIndices().

See Also:

    • toCsr

      public CsrFieldMatrix<T> toCsr()

      Converts this sparse COO matrix to an equivalent compressed sparse row (CSR) matrix.

      It is often easier and more efficient to construct a matrix in COO format first then convert to a CSR matrix for efficient computations.

      Specified by:
      toCsr in class CooFieldMatrixBase<CooFieldMatrix<T extends Field<T>>,FieldMatrix<T extends Field<T>>,CooFieldVector<T extends Field<T>>,FieldVector<T extends Field<T>>,T extends Field<T>>
      Returns:
      A CSR matrix equivalent to this COO matrix.
